700073f-a.title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse
700073f-a.text:
East 138th Street at the N.W. corner of Grand Concourse (Mott
Ave.).
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

701125f-c.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)
701125f-c.text:
Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), north from and including East 138th Street. On the right appears the Mott Haven station of the New York Central Railroad at the N.E. corner of the aforementioned thoroughfares.
November 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
An exclusive view of the Mott Haven station and part of the elevated structure of the railroad. The latter runs on Park Ave.
November 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

700072f-b.title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse
700072f-b.text:
E. 138th Street, at he S.W.corner of Wrand -oncourse, showing the W. P. A. erecting a trailer camp to accommodate the American Nwegionnafres, who arrived for their 1937 convention. In rear of the camp is the New York Central Railroad bridge spanning the
Harlem River.
Sept.14,1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs 'roject
(2)
The same, a few days later.
Sept.17, 1937
W.P.e, Photo
Five ~oroughs Project
(3)
Part of the trailer camp site, viewed northwestward across E. 138th Street. The five story factory is at the N.W. corner
og Walton Avenue.
Sept. 14, 1937
W.P.S. Photo
Five Boroughs ~roject

700069f-b.text:

700070f-a.title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse
700070f-a.text:
East 138th Street, at the S.W. corner of Grand Concourse. Note the free trailer camp for the members of the American Legion who arrived
here for their convention in the Summer of 1937.
September 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

700071f-a.title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse
700071f-a.text:
(1)

National Convention.
September 14, 1937

Five Boroughs Project

Central tracks.
September 1937

Five Boroughs Project

701126f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)
701126f-a.text:
(1)
308 to 322 Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), east side, between East 138th and 144th Streets. The 3-story frame structure bears No. 308 and the three brick houses, under demolition, bear Nos. 318 to 322.
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
An exclusive view of No. 308.
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

701127f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)
701127f-a.text:
346 and 348 Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), east side, between East 138th and 144th Streets, showing a 2 and 3-story frame house.
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
